snippet: Since insurers pay more for patients with surgical complications, some hospitals could actually lose money by improving care, researchers said Tuesday.
abstract: Study published in Journal of American Medical Assn finds that hospitals profit from their own mistakes because insurers pay them for longer stays and extra care that patients need to treat surgical complications that could have been prevented; results mean some hospitals could actually lose money by improving care.
lead_paragraph: Since insurers pay more for patients with surgical complications, some hospitals could actually lose money by improving care, researchers said Tuesday.
